enhanced_by.reason: The empty() method removes all child nodes from each matched element, which can be a prerequisite for the remove() method to function correctly.
The unwrap() method removes the matched elements from the DOM but keeps their children, which can be a prerequisite for the remove() method to function correctly.
The outerHtml() method returns the combined outer HTML of all matched elements, which can be used to verify the state of the DOM after the remove() method has been called.
The text() method returns the combined text of all the matched elements, which can be used to verify the state of the DOM after the remove() method has been called.
